name: Bandit Activity
description: Bandit raids threaten your trade routes and settlements

criticalFailure.msg: Major bandit raids
manualEffects: Choose or roll for one random ongoing worksite. That worksite is destroyed (remove all progress)

name: Corruption Scandal
description: Corruption among your officials is exposed

criticalFailure.msg: Lose gold and fame (major corruption exposed publicly)

name: Crime Wave
description: Criminal activity surges throughout your settlements

criticalFailure.msg: Major crime wave

name: Diplomatic Incident
description: A diplomatic misstep strains relations with neighbors

manualEffects: Choose or roll for one neighboring kingdom. Their attitude toward you worsens by 1 step (e.g., Friendly → Indifferent)

criticalFailure.msg: Multiple kingdoms turn against you
manualEffects: Choose or roll for two neighboring kingdoms. Each kingdom's attitude toward you worsens by 1 step (e.g., Friendly → Indifferent)

name: Emigration Threat
description: Citizens threaten to leave your kingdom permanently

manualEffects: Choose or roll for one random ongoing worksite. That worksite is destroyed (remove all progress)

criticalFailure.msg: Mass emigration causes chaos and abandoned projects
manualEffects: Choose or roll for one random ongoing worksite. That worksite is destroyed (remove all progress)

name: Protests
description: Citizens take to the streets in organized protests

criticalFailure.msg: Lose gold and fame

name: Rising Tensions
description: General tensions rise throughout your kingdom

criticalFailure.msg: Gain unrest

name: Work Stoppage
description: Workers in your kingdom refuse to continue their labor

criticalFailure.msg: Widespread work stoppage causes chaos

name: Assassination Attempt
description: An assassin targets one of your kingdom's leaders

criticalFailure.msg: Leader wounded
manualEffects: Choose or roll for one random PC leader. That PC cannot take a Kingdom Action this turn (they are recovering from wounds)

name: Diplomatic Crisis
description: A serious diplomatic crisis threatens relations

manualEffects: Choose or roll for one neighboring kingdom. Their attitude toward you worsens by 1 step (e.g., Friendly → Indifferent)

criticalFailure.msg: Multiple kingdoms turn against you
manualEffects: Choose or roll for two neighboring kingdoms. Each kingdom's attitude toward you worsens by 1 step (e.g., Friendly → Indifferent)

name: Disease Outbreak
description: A dangerous disease spreads through your settlements

failure.msg: Lose food (feeding the sick) and gain unrest

criticalFailure.msg: Lose food and gain unrest
manualEffects: Choose or roll for one Medicine or Faith structure. Mark that structure as damaged

name: Infrastructure Damage
description: Critical infrastructure is damaged or sabotaged

manualEffects: Choose or roll for one random structure in a random settlement. Mark that structure as damaged

criticalFailure.msg: Widespread infrastructure damage causes chaos
manualEffects: Roll 1d3. Mark that many random structures as damaged (choose or roll for random settlements)

name: Mass Exodus
description: Large numbers of citizens flee your kingdom

failure.msg: Citizens abandon projects and cause social unrest
manualEffects: Choose or roll for one random ongoing worksite. That worksite is destroyed (remove all progress)

criticalFailure.msg: Mass exodus damages your kingdom's reputation and stability
manualEffects: Choose or roll for one random ongoing worksite. That worksite is destroyed (remove all progress)

name: Production Strike
description: Workers strike, halting resource production

criticalFailure.msg: Prolonged strike devastates production

name: Riot
description: Violent riots break out in your settlements

failure.msg: Riot damages property and increases unrest
manualEffects: Choose or roll for one random structure in a random settlement. Mark that structure as damaged

criticalFailure.msg: Violent riot destroys property and increases unrest
manualEffects: Choose or roll for one random structure in a random settlement. Reduce that structure's tier by one and mark it as damaged. If the tier is reduced to zero, remove it entirely

name: Settlement Crisis
description: One of your settlements faces a major crisis

failure.msg: Choose how to handle the settlement crisis

choices.label: Pay for emergency aid - lose {gold} gold
Let the settlement suffer - 1 structure damaged

manualEffects: Choose or roll for one random settlement. If you chose 'structure damaged', damage 1 random structure in that settlement

criticalFailure.msg: A settlement collapses under the crisis
manualEffects: Choose or roll for one random settlement. That settlement loses one level (minimum level 1)

name: Tax Revolt
description: Citizens revolt against tax collection

criticalFailure.msg: Lose gold and gain unrest

name: Trade Embargo
description: Neighboring kingdoms impose trade restrictions

criticalFailure.msg: Lose gold AND resources, gain unrest

name: Border Raid
description: Enemy forces raid your border territories

failure.msg: Raiders pillage border territories, causing loss of gold and land
manualEffects: Remove 1 border hex from your kingdom map

criticalFailure.msg: Raiders devastate border regions, causing massive losses
manualEffects: Roll 1d3 and remove that many border hexes from your kingdom map

name: Economic Crash
description: A severe economic downturn threatens your kingdom's prosperity

manualEffects: Mark your highest tier commerce structure as damaged

criticalFailure.msg: Economic collapse devastates your kingdom
manualEffects: Reduce your highest tier commerce structure's tier by one and mark it as damaged. If the tier is reduced to zero, remove it entirely

name: Guerrilla Movement
description: Armed rebels seize control of kingdom territory

failure.msg: Rebels seize territory in your kingdom
manualEffects: Roll 1d3 and mark that many hexes as rebel-controlled (cannot use these hexes until rebellion is resolved)

criticalFailure.msg: Rebels establish a stronghold and raise an army against you
manualEffects: Roll 2d3 and mark that many hexes as rebel-controlled (cannot use these hexes until rebellion is resolved)
Rebels raise an army with level = (your kingdom level - 1). Track this army as an enemy force

name: International Crisis
description: Multiple kingdoms turn against you due to internal chaos

manualEffects: Choose or roll for one neighboring kingdom. Their attitude toward you worsens by 2 steps (e.g., Friendly → Indifferent → Unfriendly)

criticalFailure.msg: Multiple kingdoms turn against you
manualEffects: Choose or roll for two neighboring kingdoms. Each kingdom's attitude toward you worsens by 2 steps (e.g., Friendly → Indifferent → Unfriendly)

name: International Scandal
description: A massive scandal ruins your kingdom's reputation

failure.msg: Your kingdom's reputation suffers, losing fame and gold

criticalFailure.msg: Devastating scandal cripples your kingdom's standing
manualEffects: Your kingdom's fame is reduced to 0 for the remainder of this turn (regardless of current value)
Your kingdom cannot gain fame for the remainder of this turn

name: Mass Desertion Threat
description: Your armies threaten mass desertion

failure.msg: Military morale crisis damages your forces
manualEffects: Choose 1 army. That army must make a morale check (DC = kingdom level + 5). On failure, the army disbands
Mark your highest tier military structure as damaged

criticalFailure.msg: Widespread desertion devastates your military
manualEffects: Choose 2 armies. Each army must make a morale check (DC = kingdom level + 5). On failure, the army disbands
Reduce your highest tier military structure's tier by one and mark it as damaged. If the tier is reduced to zero, remove it entirely

name: Noble Conspiracy
description: Nobles plot to overthrow the kingdom's leadership

success.msg: Conspiracy exposed and dealt with, no effect

failure.msg: The conspiracy damages your kingdom's stability and reputation

criticalFailure.msg: The conspiracy strikes a devastating blow to your kingdom
manualEffects: Choose or roll for one random PC leader. That PC loses their kingdom action this turn (they are dealing with the conspiracy)

name: Prison Breaks
description: Mass prison breaks release dangerous criminals

failure.msg: Mass prison break releases many criminals
manualEffects: Convert half of your imprisoned unrest to regular unrest (round down)
Mark your highest tier justice structure as damaged

criticalFailure.msg: Complete prison break releases all criminals and destroys your justice system
manualEffects: Convert ALL of your imprisoned unrest to regular unrest
Reduce your highest tier justice structure's tier by one and mark it as damaged. If the tier is reduced to zero, remove it entirely

name: Religious Schism
description: Religious divisions tear your kingdom apart

failure.msg: Religious divisions weaken your kingdom's faith institutions
manualEffects: Mark your highest tier religious structure as damaged

criticalFailure.msg: The church splits entirely, destroying religious unity
manualEffects: Reduce your highest tier religious structure's tier by one and mark it as damaged. If the tier is reduced to zero, remove it entirely

name: Secession Crisis
description: A settlement declares independence from your kingdom

failure.msg: A settlement revolts against your kingdom
manualEffects: Choose or roll for one settlement. That settlement loses one level (minimum level 1)
Reduce the highest tier structure's tier in that settlement by one and mark it as damaged. If the tier is reduced to zero, remove it entirely

criticalFailure.msg: A settlement successfully declares independence from your kingdom
manualEffects: Choose or roll for one settlement. That settlement and all adjacent hexes secede from your kingdom (remove them from your map and mark as independent city-state)
Any armies located in the seceded hexes defect to the new city-state (remove them from your control)

name: Settlement Collapse
description: A major settlement faces total collapse

failure.msg: Choose how to handle the settlement crisis

choices.label: Pay for emergency aid - lose {gold} gold
Let the settlement suffer - 2 structures damaged

manualEffects: Choose or roll for one random settlement. If you chose 'structures damaged', damage 2 random structures in that settlement

criticalFailure.msg: A settlement collapses under the crisis
manualEffects: Choose or roll for one random settlement. That settlement loses one level (minimum level 1)
Reduce 1 random structure's tier in that settlement by one and mark it as damaged. If the tier is reduced to zero, remove it entirely

name: Trade War
description: A trade war devastates your economy

failure.msg: Choose how to absorb the economic shock

criticalFailure.msg: Complete economic isolation devastates your kingdom
